availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Judd (Owsley County farmer and infantry private)

body.p: Owsley County farmer and infantry private. North Carolina native. Married Jane Venable Judd in 1865. Private of Company A, 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment, U.S.A.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Boonville, p. 31. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jackson, Gray Hawk, Pond Creek Precinct 5, p. 11. “Rev William C. Judd,” Find A Grave, October 20, 2008, memorial no. 30718436. Mountain Advocate (Barbourville, Ky.), September 29, 1905. KYR-0001-004-1337. “Judd, William C.,” Soldiers and Sailors Database, National Park Service, https://www.nps.gov/civilwar/search-soldiers-detail.htm?soldierId=015BECAD-DC7A-DF11-BF36-B8AC6F5D926A (accessed January 19, 2017).
